column4: hello. while I am able to use mount folder  I am unable to mount the folder using fstab
its the same command as mount, just in a different order
I use sshfs#username@remote:/folder/ folder fuse defaults,idmap=user 0 0
so if you run:  sudo mount /folder   does it mount?
I do not even use sudo . Just mount /folder and it mounts
But on startup it does not mount the file. It shows an error connection reset by peer.
you'll need to add a startup command to run that then, the mount fails as the network is not up yet so the server is unreachable
Can I ensure that the command in fstab will run after the network is up? if not. where should I put the command?
No mate, Ubuntu server both of the machines
then add it in /etc/rc.local above the exit 0 line
just mount folder ? or does it need something more?
the entry in fstab wil be referenced so that's all it takes
just mount folder ? and put noauto in the fstab entry?
if it boots ok now then no need to edit fstab
Thanks a lot mate. It is working!
